name: PwC
title: CAIO as Portfolio of Accountable Owners

classification.classificationRationale: PwC appointed CAIO Dan Priest to lead AI strategy, with $1B investment over 3 years. PwC's 2026 framework describes CAIO evolving from single role to 'portfolio of accountable owners across value creation, governance, and production operations.' This is a centralized governance/enablement function — Model 2 (CoE). Medium confidence: the CAIO + $1B investment confirms formal AI structure, but internal team composition is unknown.

description:
PwC appointed Dan Priest as Chief AI Officer, previously cloud and digital leader at PwC with 11 years at the firm and prior experience as VP and CIO at Toyota Financial Services. This career path — enterprise IT (Toyota CIO) to consulting digital leader to consulting CAIO — represents a distinct variant of the CAIO pipeline.

PwC committed $1B to AI investment over three years, covering both customer-facing AI offerings and internal operations. The firm's 2026 CAIO framework articulates an evolution of the AI leadership role: from a single executive to a 'portfolio of accountable owners across value creation, governance, and production operations' — suggesting the CAIO function is being distributed across the organization while maintaining centralized coordination.

PwC advocates a dual AI strategy: 'defense' (safeguarding market position against AI-powered rivals) and 'offense' (entering or creating new markets). Key data points from PwC's research: 79% of executives say their companies are already adopting AI agents, and 58% say Responsible AI boosts ROI and efficiency.
